How to use Monvvo down payment calculator

  1. Start by entering the total purchase price of the home you are considering. This value helps calculate estimated down payment amounts.
  2. Choose your credit score range to tailor the results for different loan options, such as FHA, Conventional, or USDA loans.
  3. The calculator will display estimated down payment amounts, including FHA (3.5%), Conventional (3%-5% and 20%), and USDA (no down payment if eligible).
  4. Add the amount of money you’ve already saved toward your down payment.
  5. Enter how much you can save each month to plan your savings timeline.
  6. See a breakdown of the estimated down payment amounts and a timeline showing how long it will take to reach each goal.
  7. Modify the inputs to explore different scenarios and find the savings plan that works best for your needs.

Down Payment Terms

Down Payment

The amount you pay upfront when purchasing a home. Common down payment percentages include 3.5% for FHA loans, 3%-5% for Conventional loans, and 20% to avoid Private Mortgage Insurance (PMI). USDA loans typically require no down payment for eligible buyers.

Home Price

The total purchase price of the home, used to calculate the required down payment.

Credit Score

A numerical representation of your creditworthiness. Higher credit scores often qualify for lower down payment requirements and better loan terms.

Current Savings

The amount of money you have already set aside for your down payment.

Monthly Contributions

The amount you plan to save each month toward your down payment goal.
